returnParameters.description:
a string consisting of all of parameter `strs` concatenated in order
with parameter `separator` in between them

functions.name: 'join
functions.description:
Joins zero or more strings together with a separator.

```ballerina
string:'join(" ", "Ballerina", "is", "a", "programming", "language") ⇒ Ballerina is a programming language
string[] array = ["John", "23", "USA", "Computer Science", "Swimmer"];
string:'join(",", ...array) ⇒ John,23,USA,Computer Science,Swimmer
```

parameters.name: str1
parameters.description: the first string to be compared

parameters.name: str2
parameters.description: the second string to be compared

returnParameters.description:
an int that is less than, equal to or greater than zero,
according as parameter `str1` is less than, equal to or greater than parameter `str2`

functions.name: codePointCompare
functions.description:
Lexicographically compares strings using their Unicode code points.

This orders strings in a consistent and well-defined way,
but the ordering will often not be consistent with cultural expectations
for sorted order.

```ballerina
"Austria".codePointCompare("Australia") ⇒ 1
```

returnParameters.description: concatenation of all of the parameter `strs`; empty string if parameter `strs` is empty

functions.name: concat
functions.description:
Concatenates zero or more strings.

```ballerina
"http://worldtimeapi.org".concat("/api/timezone/", "Asia", "/", "Colombo") ⇒ http://worldtimeapi.org/api/timezone/Asia/Colombo
// Alternative approach to achieve the same.
string:concat("http://worldtimeapi.org", "/api/timezone/", "Asia", "/", "Colombo") ⇒ http://worldtimeapi.org/api/timezone/Asia/Colombo
```

returnParameters.description: true if parameter `str` ends with parameter `substr`; false otherwise

functions.name: endsWith
functions.description:
Tests whether a string ends with another string.

```ballerina
"Welcome to the Ballerina programming language".endsWith("language") ⇒ true
```

parameters.name: str1
parameters.description: the first string to be compared

parameters.name: str2
parameters.description: the second string to be compared

returnParameters.description:
true if parameter `str1` is the same as parameter `str2`, treating upper-case and lower-case
ASCII letters as the same; false, otherwise

functions.name: equalsIgnoreCaseAscii
functions.description:
Tests whether two strings are the same, ignoring the case of ASCII characters.

A character in the range a-z is treated the same as the corresponding character in the range A-Z.

```ballerina
"BALLERINA".equalsIgnoreCaseAscii("ballerina") ⇒ true
```

returnParameters.description: parameter `bytes` converted to string or error

functions.name: fromBytes
functions.description:
Constructs a string from its UTF-8 representation in bytes.

```ballerina
string:fromBytes([72, 101, 108, 108, 111, 32, 66, 97, 108, 108, 101, 114, 105, 110, 97, 33]) ⇒ Hello, World!
string:fromBytes([149, 169, 224]) ⇒ error
```

parameters.name: codePoint
parameters.description: an int specifying a code point

returnParameters.description:
a single character string whose code point is parameter `codePoint`; or an error
if parameter `codePoint` is not a valid code point

functions.name: fromCodePointInt
functions.description:
Constructs a single character string from a code point.

An int is a valid code point if it is in the range 0 to 0x10FFFF inclusive,
but not in the range 0xD800 or 0xDFFF inclusive.

```ballerina
string:fromCodePointInt(97) ⇒ a
string:fromCodePointInt(1114113) ⇒ error
```

parameters.name: codePoints
parameters.description: an array of ints, each specifying a code point

returnParameters.description:
a string with a character for each code point in parameter `codePoints`; or an error
if any member of parameter `codePoints` is not a valid code point

functions.name: fromCodePointInts
functions.description:
Constructs a string from an array of code points.

An int is a valid code point if it is in the range 0 to 0x10FFFF inclusive,
but not in the range 0xD800 or 0xDFFF inclusive.

```ballerina
string:fromCodePointInts([66, 97, 108, 108, 101, 114, 105, 110, 97]) ⇒ Ballerina
string:fromCodePointInts([1114113, 1114114, 1114115]) ⇒ error
```

returnParameters.description: the Unicode code point of the character at parameter `index` in parameter `str`

functions.name: getCodePoint
functions.description:
Returns the code point of a character in a string.

```ballerina
"Hello, World!".getCodePoint(3) ⇒ 108
```

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string in which to search

returnParameters.description:
`true` if there is an occurrence of parameter `substr` in parameter `str` at an index >= parameter `startIndex`,
or `false` otherwise

functions.name: includes
functions.description:
Tests whether a string includes another string.

```ballerina
"Hello World, from Ballerina".includes("Bal") ⇒ true
"Hello World! from Ballerina".includes("Hello", 10) ⇒ false
```

returnParameters.description: true if the is a match of `re` somewhere within `str`, otherwise false

functions.name: includesMatch
functions.description:
Tests whether there is a match of a regular expression somewhere within a string.
This is equivalent to `regexp:find(re, str, startIndex) != ()`.

```ballerina
"This will match".includesMatch(re `Th.*ch`) ⇒ true
"Will this match".includesMatch(re `th.*ch`, 5) ⇒ true
"Not a match".includesMatch(re `Th.*ch`) ⇒ false
"Will this match".includesMatch(re `Th.*ch`, 5) ⇒ false
```

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string in which to search

returnParameters.description:
index of the first occurrence of parameter `substr` in parameter `str` that is >= parameter `startIndex`,
or `()` if there is no such occurrence

functions.name: indexOf
functions.description:
Finds the first occurrence of one string in another string.

```ballerina
"New Zealand".indexOf("land") ⇒ 7
"Ballerinalang is a unique programming language".indexOf("lang", 15) ⇒ 38
```

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string to be iterated over

returnParameters.description: a new iterator object

functions.name: iterator

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: the string in which to search

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: index to start searching backwards from

returnParameters.description:
index of the last occurrence of parameter `substr` in parameter `str` that is <= parameter `startIndex`,
or `()` if there is no such occurrence

functions.name: lastIndexOf
functions.description:
Finds the last occurrence of one string in another string.

```ballerina
"Ballerinalang is a unique programming language".lastIndexOf("lang") ⇒ 38
// Search backwards for the last occurrence of a string from a specific index.
"Ballerinalang is a unique programming language".lastIndexOf("lang", 15) ⇒ 9
```

returnParameters.description: the number of characters (code points) in parameter `str`

functions.name: length
functions.description:
Returns the length of the string.

```ballerina
"Hello, World!".length() ⇒ 13;
```

returnParameters.description: true if there is full match of `re` with `str`, and false otherwise

functions.name: matches
functions.description:
Tests whether there is a full match of a regular expression with a string.
A match of a regular expression in a string is a full match if it
starts at index 0 and ends at index `n`, where `n` is the length of the string.
This is equivalent to `regex:isFullMatch(re, str)`.

```ballerina
"This is a Match".matches(re `A|Th.*ch|^`) ⇒ true
"Not a Match".matches(re `A|Th.*ch|^`) ⇒ false
```

parameters.name: len
parameters.description: the length of the string to be returned

parameters.name: padChar
parameters.description: the character to use for padding `str`; defaults to a space character

returnParameters.description: `str` padded with `padChar`

functions.name: padEnd
functions.description:
Adds padding to the end of a string.
Adds sufficient `padChar` characters to the end of `str` to make its length be `len`.
If the length of `str` is >= `len`, returns `str`.

```ballerina
"Ballerina for developers".padEnd(30) ⇒ Ballerina for developers
"Ballerina for developers".padEnd(30, "!") ⇒ Ballerina for developers!!!!!!
```

parameters.name: len
parameters.description: the length of the string to be returned

parameters.name: padChar
parameters.description: the character to use for padding `str`; defaults to a space character

returnParameters.description: `str` padded with `padChar`

functions.name: padStart
functions.description:
Adds padding to the start of a string.
Adds sufficient `padChar` characters at the start of `str` to make its length be `len`.
If the length of `str` is >= `len`, returns `str`.

```ballerina
"100Km".padStart(10) ⇒      100Km
"100Km".padStart(10, "0") ⇒ 00000100Km
```

parameters.name: len
parameters.description: the length of the string to be returned

parameters.name: zeroChar
parameters.description: the character to use for the zero; defaults to ASCII zero `0`

returnParameters.description: `str` padded with zeros

functions.name: padZero
functions.description:
Pads a string with zeros.
The zeros are added at the start of the string, after a `+` or `-` sign if there is one.
Sufficient zero characters are added to `str` to make its length be `len`.
If the length of `str` is >= `len`, returns `str`.

```ballerina
"-256".padZero(9) ⇒ -00000256
"-880".padZero(8, "#") ⇒ -####880
```

returnParameters.description: true if parameter `str` starts with parameter `substr`; false otherwise

functions.name: startsWith
functions.description:
Tests whether a string starts with another string.

```ballerina
"Welcome to the Ballerina programming language".startsWith("Welcome") ⇒ true
```

returnParameters.description: substring consisting of characters with index >= `startIndex` and < `endIndex`

functions.name: substring
functions.description:
Returns a substring of a string.

```ballerina
"Hello, my name is John".substring(7) ⇒ my name is John
"Hello, my name is John Anderson".substring(18, 22) ⇒ John
```

returnParameters.description: UTF-8 byte array

functions.name: toBytes
functions.description:
Represents a string as an array of bytes using UTF-8.

```ballerina
"Hello, World!".toBytes() ⇒ [72,101,108,108,111,44,32,87,111,114,108,100,33]
```

returnParameters.description: the code point of parameter `ch`

functions.name: toCodePointInt
functions.description:
Converts a single character string to a code point.

```ballerina
string:toCodePointInt("a") ⇒ 97
```

returnParameters.description: an array with a code point for each character of parameter `str`

functions.name: toCodePointInts
functions.description:
Converts a string to an array of code points.

```ballerina
"Hello, world 🌎".toCodePointInts() ⇒ [72,101,108,108,111,44,32,119,111,114,108,100,32,127758]
```

returnParameters.description: parameter `str` with any occurrences of A-Z converted to a-z

functions.name: toLowerAscii
functions.description:
Converts occurrences of A-Z to a-z.

Other characters are left unchanged.

```ballerina
"HELLO, World!".toLowerAscii() ⇒ hello, world!
```

returnParameters.description: parameter `str` with any occurrences of a-z converted to A-Z

functions.name: toUpperAscii
functions.description:
Converts occurrences of a-z to A-Z.

Other characters are left unchanged.

```ballerina
"hello, World!".toUpperAscii() ⇒ HELLO, WORLD!
```

returnParameters.description: parameter `str` with leading or trailing ASCII white space characters removed

functions.name: trim
functions.description:
Removes ASCII white space characters from the start and end of a string.

The ASCII white space characters are 0x9...0xD, 0x20.

```ballerina
" Hello World   ".trim() + "!" ⇒ Hello World!
```

types.name: Char
types.description: Built-in subtype of string containing strings of length 1.

modules.summary: The `lang.string` module corresponds to the `string` basic type.
modules.description:
## Module overview

The `lang.string` module corresponds to the `string` basic type.
The `lang.string` module corresponds to the `string` basic type.

functions.description:
Joins zero or more strings together with a separator.

```ballerina
string:'join(" ", "Ballerina", "is", "a", "programming", "language") ⇒ Ballerina is a programming language
string[] array = ["John", "23", "USA", "Computer Science", "Swimmer"];
string:'join(",", ...array) ⇒ John,23,USA,Computer Science,Swimmer
```

Lexicographically compares strings using their Unicode code points.

This orders strings in a consistent and well-defined way,
but the ordering will often not be consistent with cultural expectations
for sorted order.

```ballerina
"Austria".codePointCompare("Australia") ⇒ 1
```

Concatenates zero or more strings.

```ballerina
"http://worldtimeapi.org".concat("/api/timezone/", "Asia", "/", "Colombo") ⇒ http://worldtimeapi.org/api/timezone/Asia/Colombo
// Alternative approach to achieve the same.
string:concat("http://worldtimeapi.org", "/api/timezone/", "Asia", "/", "Colombo") ⇒ http://worldtimeapi.org/api/timezone/Asia/Colombo
```

Tests whether a string ends with another string.

```ballerina
"Welcome to the Ballerina programming language".endsWith("language") ⇒ true
```

Tests whether two strings are the same, ignoring the case of ASCII characters.

A character in the range a-z is treated the same as the corresponding character in the range A-Z.

```ballerina
"BALLERINA".equalsIgnoreCaseAscii("ballerina") ⇒ true
```

Constructs a string from its UTF-8 representation in bytes.

```ballerina
string:fromBytes([72, 101, 108, 108, 111, 32, 66, 97, 108, 108, 101, 114, 105, 110, 97, 33]) ⇒ Hello, World!
string:fromBytes([149, 169, 224]) ⇒ error
```

Constructs a single character string from a code point.

An int is a valid code point if it is in the range 0 to 0x10FFFF inclusive,
but not in the range 0xD800 or 0xDFFF inclusive.

```ballerina
string:fromCodePointInt(97) ⇒ a
string:fromCodePointInt(1114113) ⇒ error
```

Constructs a string from an array of code points.

An int is a valid code point if it is in the range 0 to 0x10FFFF inclusive,
but not in the range 0xD800 or 0xDFFF inclusive.

```ballerina
string:fromCodePointInts([66, 97, 108, 108, 101, 114, 105, 110, 97]) ⇒ Ballerina
string:fromCodePointInts([1114113, 1114114, 1114115]) ⇒ error
```

Returns the code point of a character in a string.

```ballerina
"Hello, World!".getCodePoint(3) ⇒ 108
```

Tests whether a string includes another string.

```ballerina
"Hello World, from Ballerina".includes("Bal") ⇒ true
"Hello World! from Ballerina".includes("Hello", 10) ⇒ false
```

Tests whether there is a match of a regular expression somewhere within a string.
This is equivalent to `regexp:find(re, str, startIndex) != ()`.

```ballerina
"This will match".includesMatch(re `Th.*ch`) ⇒ true
"Will this match".includesMatch(re `th.*ch`, 5) ⇒ true
"Not a match".includesMatch(re `Th.*ch`) ⇒ false
"Will this match".includesMatch(re `Th.*ch`, 5) ⇒ false
```

Finds the first occurrence of one string in another string.

```ballerina
"New Zealand".indexOf("land") ⇒ 7
"Ballerinalang is a unique programming language".indexOf("lang", 15) ⇒ 38
```

Finds the last occurrence of one string in another string.

```ballerina
"Ballerinalang is a unique programming language".lastIndexOf("lang") ⇒ 38
// Search backwards for the last occurrence of a string from a specific index.
"Ballerinalang is a unique programming language".lastIndexOf("lang", 15) ⇒ 9
```

Returns the length of the string.

```ballerina
"Hello, World!".length() ⇒ 13;
```

Tests whether there is a full match of a regular expression with a string.
A match of a regular expression in a string is a full match if it
starts at index 0 and ends at index `n`, where `n` is the length of the string.
This is equivalent to `regex:isFullMatch(re, str)`.

```ballerina
"This is a Match".matches(re `A|Th.*ch|^`) ⇒ true
"Not a Match".matches(re `A|Th.*ch|^`) ⇒ false
```

Adds padding to the end of a string.
Adds sufficient `padChar` characters to the end of `str` to make its length be `len`.
If the length of `str` is >= `len`, returns `str`.

```ballerina
"Ballerina for developers".padEnd(30) ⇒ Ballerina for developers
"Ballerina for developers".padEnd(30, "!") ⇒ Ballerina for developers!!!!!!
```

Adds padding to the start of a string.
Adds sufficient `padChar` characters at the start of `str` to make its length be `len`.
If the length of `str` is >= `len`, returns `str`.

```ballerina
"100Km".padStart(10) ⇒      100Km
"100Km".padStart(10, "0") ⇒ 00000100Km
```

Pads a string with zeros.
The zeros are added at the start of the string, after a `+` or `-` sign if there is one.
Sufficient zero characters are added to `str` to make its length be `len`.
If the length of `str` is >= `len`, returns `str`.

```ballerina
"-256".padZero(9) ⇒ -00000256
"-880".padZero(8, "#") ⇒ -####880
```

Tests whether a string starts with another string.

```ballerina
"Welcome to the Ballerina programming language".startsWith("Welcome") ⇒ true
```

Returns a substring of a string.

```ballerina
"Hello, my name is John".substring(7) ⇒ my name is John
"Hello, my name is John Anderson".substring(18, 22) ⇒ John
```

Represents a string as an array of bytes using UTF-8.

```ballerina
"Hello, World!".toBytes() ⇒ [72,101,108,108,111,44,32,87,111,114,108,100,33]
```

Converts a single character string to a code point.

```ballerina
string:toCodePointInt("a") ⇒ 97
```

Converts a string to an array of code points.

```ballerina
"Hello, world 🌎".toCodePointInts() ⇒ [72,101,108,108,111,44,32,119,111,114,108,100,32,127758]
```

Converts occurrences of A-Z to a-z.

Other characters are left unchanged.

```ballerina
"HELLO, World!".toLowerAscii() ⇒ hello, world!
```

Converts occurrences of a-z to A-Z.

Other characters are left unchanged.

```ballerina
"hello, World!".toUpperAscii() ⇒ HELLO, WORLD!
```

Removes ASCII white space characters from the start and end of a string.

The ASCII white space characters are 0x9...0xD, 0x20.

```ballerina
" Hello World   ".trim() + "!" ⇒ Hello World!
```

types.description: Built-in subtype of string containing strings of length 1.
